title: Los Angeles Pension Ramps Up Private-Equity Investing
sub_head: The $23.2 billion system raised the amount staff can commit to private-equity managers to as much as $150 million
body:
The Los Angeles City Employees’ Retirement System is increasing the amount of capital its staff can commit to private equity without preapproval as part of a bid to form fewer but larger relationships with fund managers and get better legal and economic terms for investments.
Lacers’ board on March 22 approved raising the pension system’s limit on the amount its investment staff can commit to private-equity funds to $150 million without prior approval.
